H0.text: Dinosaurs are the best-known extinct vertebrates.

H1.text: Snakes are the best-known extinct vertebrates.

H2.text: Trees are the best-known extinct vertebrates.

H3.text: Trilobites are the best-known extinct vertebrates.

A4.text: Over 900 non-avian dinosaur genera have been confidently identified (2018) with 1124 species (2016).

A5.text: Through most of the 20th century, before birds were recognized as dinosaurs, most of the scientific community believed dinosaurs to have been sluggish and cold-blooded.
